parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any parliamentary candidate.  The post promotes a Christmas event ("Aprinderea Luminitelor") and does not mention any political candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and promotes a community event. It is clearly intended to reach a wide audience in Ploiești.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote a Christmas event, not to influence the vote for any candidate in the parliamentary elections. The content is entirely unrelated to the electoral process.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post could be considered a form of community announcement, it does not fall under journalistic standards. It's a promotional announcement for a public event.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express a personal opinion.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>539445968997793</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a Christmas event in Ploiești.  There is no mention of any political candidate, party, or any content related to the parliamentary elections. The post's objective is purely promotional, aiming to inform the public about a community event.  The paid nature of the post on a public platform does not automatically qualify it as electoral propaganda if the content itself is unrelated to the elections.  The fact that the advertiser, Mihai Polițeanu, is a public figure (Mayor of Ploiești) does not automatically make the post electoral propaganda. The content is entirely separate from any electoral campaign.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
